sub_concepts.name: Algorithm
sub_concepts.definition: a well-defined procedure that takes input and produces output

sub_concepts.name: Data Structures
sub_concepts.definition: a way of organizing and storing data for efficient access and modification

sub_concepts.name: Variables and Types
sub_concepts.definition: a named location used to store data in memory, and a classification of data based on its properties

sub_concepts.name: Control Structures
sub_concepts.definition: a way of controlling the flow of a program through the use of conditionals and loops

sub_concepts.name: Functions
sub_concepts.definition: a named sequence of instructions that can be called and executed multiple times within a program

sub_concepts.name: Error Handling
sub_concepts.definition: the ability of a program to detect, diagnose, and handle unexpected conditions or inputs

sub_concepts.name: Software Engineering
sub_concepts.definition: the application of engineering principles to the development and maintenance of software systems

sub_concepts.name: Databases
sub_concepts.definition: a collection of organized data that can be queried and manipulated by a computer program

sub_concepts.name: Operating Systems
sub_concepts.definition: the software that manages and controls the computer hardware and provides services to other software

sub_concepts.name: Computer Networks
sub_concepts.definition: a collection of interconnected computers that can communicate and share resources with each other
